alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 11:45PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River Near Elko affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Upper Humboldt...including Elko...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Humboldt River Near Elko. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.2 feet, Minor Flood Stage - Minor lowland flooding occurs upstream and downstream of Elko. Very minor flooding from backed up storm drains begins in Elko, especially in the parking lots on Water Street between 7th and 9th Streets. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:25 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 5.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady below flood stage at 5.4 feet. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.2 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 100 PM PDT.
